stock.controller

Interface Features

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    StockControllerGUI.FeaturesImpl

    public interface Features
    An interface that represents various features of the program. Each method in this interface acts like a callback for the view. The view pushes any data it receives through any of these methods. These methods in turn call the corresponding model methods.

    • Method Detail

      • createPortfolio

        void createPortfolio(java.lang.String portfolioName)
        Creates a portfolio with the given name.
        Parameters:
        portfolioName - the unique name for the portfolio.

      • createStrategyDollarCost

        void createStrategyDollarCost(java.lang.String strategyName,
                              java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> tickerWeight,
                              java.time.LocalDate start,
                              java.time.LocalDate end,
                              double amount,
                              double commission,
                              int frequency,
                              boolean save,
                              boolean apply,
                              boolean load,
                              java.lang.String portfolioInfo,
                              boolean savePort)
        Creates a dollar cost strategy with all possible parameters present.
        Parameters:
        strategyName - name of the strategy
        tickerWeight - the weight ticker mapping for each symbol.
        start - the start date to begin investment from.
        end - the end date when the investment ends.
        amount - the amount to be invested in each investment.
        commission - the commission per transaction.
        frequency - the intervals in which strategy is executed.
        save - whether user wants to save this strategy.
        apply - whether user wants to execute this strategy.
        load - whether portfolio is loaded from disk
        portfolioInfo - the name or path of the portfolio.
        savePort - whether portfolio is to be saved after execution

      • createStrategyRegular

        void createStrategyRegular(java.lang.String tickerSymbol,
                           double amount,
                           double commission,
                           java.time.LocalDate dateTime,
                           boolean save,
                           boolean apply,
                           boolean load,
                           java.lang.String portfolioInfo,
                           java.lang.String strategyName,
                           boolean savePort)
        Creates a regular buying strategy for the portfolio.
        Parameters:
        tickerSymbol - the symbol of the stock
        amount - the amount worth of stocks to be bought.
        commission - the commission per transaction
        dateTime - datetime at which it is bought.
        save - whether user wants to save this strategy.
        apply - whether user wants to execute this strategy.
        load - whether portfolio is loaded from disk
        portfolioInfo - the name or path of the portfolio.
        strategyName - unique name of the strategy.
        savePort - whether portfolio is to be saved after execution

      • getCostBasis

        java.util.Optional<java.lang.Double> getCostBasis(boolean loadPortfolio,
                                                  java.lang.String portfolioNamePath,
                                                  java.time.LocalDate dateTime)
        Returns the cost basis of a portfolio on a given date.
        Parameters:
        loadPortfolio - whether portfolio is loaded from the disk.
        portfolioNamePath - the path or name of the portfolio.
        dateTime - the date time at which cost basis is requested.
        Returns:
        Optional as double if value is present, empty otherwise.

      • getCurrentValue

        java.util.Optional<java.lang.Double> getCurrentValue(boolean loadPortfolio,
                                                     java.lang.String portfolioNamePath,
                                                     java.time.LocalDate dateTime)
        Returns the current value of a portfolio on a given date.
        Parameters:
        loadPortfolio - whether portfolio is loaded from the disk.
        portfolioNamePath - the path or name of the portfolio.
        dateTime - the date time at which current value is requested.
        Returns:
        Optional as double if value is present, empty otherwise.

      • addStock

        void addStock(boolean loadPortfolio,
              java.lang.String portfolioNamePath,
              java.lang.String strategyPath,
              boolean shouldPort)
        Buys a stock or stocks based on the strategy passed into the given portfolio.
        Parameters:
        loadPortfolio - whether portfolio is loaded from the disk.
        portfolioNamePath - the path or name of portfolio.
        strategyPath - the path of strategy file.
        shouldPort - whether to save portfolio after the transaction.

      • getGraphData

        CostValues getGraphData(boolean load,
                        java.lang.String portfolioName,
                        java.time.LocalDateTime start,
                        java.time.LocalDateTime end)
        Get the cost basis and current value data points for given range of date.
        Parameters:
        load - whether portfolio is loaded from disk.
        portfolioName - the name of the portfolio.
        start - the start date for the graph.
        end - the end date for the graph.
        Returns:
        A bean class of cost basis and current value maps.
